wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Elwyn Edwards Jones (5 January 1904 – 4 July 1989) was a Welsh solicitor and Labour politician elected as Labour MP for Conway in 1950. He served as town clerk of Bangor from 1939 to 1969. He was knighted in 1978.He was born in Caernarfon and died in Anglesey.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1950 United Kingdom general election

response: * Sir Elwyn Jones (solicitor) (1904–1989), Welsh solicitor, town clerk of Bangor, and briefly a Labour MP
* Elwyn Jones, Baron Elwyn-Jones (1909–1989), Welsh barrister and politician
* Elwyn Jones (writer) (1923–1982), Welsh television writer and producer
* David Elwyn Jones (1945–2003), Welsh writer and politician
